In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the **colon** (**:**) serves the following purposes,

- : represents a [lizard](/wiki/Lizard_\(monster_class\) "Lizard (monster class)"):

  - : [newt](/wiki/Newt "Newt")
  - : [gecko](/wiki/Gecko "Gecko")
  - : [iguana](/wiki/Iguana "Iguana")
  - : [baby crocodile](/wiki/Baby_crocodile "Baby crocodile")
  - : [lizard](/wiki/Lizard "Lizard")
  - : [chameleon](/wiki/Chameleon "Chameleon")
  - : [crocodile](/wiki/Crocodile "Crocodile")
  - : [salamander](/wiki/Salamander "Salamander")

* Press [:]() to use the [near look](/wiki/Near_look "Near look") command, which looks at the square you currently are on. In menus, pressing [:]() activates [menu search](/wiki/Menu_search "Menu search"), which helps you select specific items in a menu containing a long list of items.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Variants](#Variants)

  - [1.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [1.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [1.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [1.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [1.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [2 References](#References)

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces new monsters that use the : glyph:

- : [gila monster](/wiki/Gila_monster "Gila monster")
- : [rhaumbusun](/wiki/Rhaumbusun "Rhaumbusun")
- : [basilisk](/wiki/Basilisk "Basilisk")
- : [komodo dragon](/wiki/Komodo_dragon "Komodo dragon")

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") introduces one new monster that uses the : glyph:

- : [giant turtle](/wiki/Giant_turtle "Giant turtle")

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), version 3.0 changed the glyph for the lizard monster class to l (lowercase L) to avoid using punctuation glyphs, and moved [leprechauns](/wiki/Leprechaun "Leprechaun") into the ​i [imp or minor demon](/wiki/Minor_demon "Minor demon") class. This was reverted in version 6.0.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") introduces two new monsters that use the : glyph:

- : [giant turtle](/wiki/Giant_turtle "Giant turtle")
- : [frost salamander](/wiki/Frost_salamander "Frost salamander")

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") retains the monsters added in SlashTHEM and adds new monsters that use the : glyph:

- : [deminewt](/index.php?title=Deminewt\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Deminewt (page does not exist)")
- : [master newt](/index.php?title=Master_newt\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Master newt (page does not exist)")
- : [giant turtle](/wiki/Giant_turtle "Giant turtle")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [xNetHack commit 6f0e026: "Move lizards back to : and leprechauns back to l"](https://github.com/copperwater/xNetHack/commit/6f0e0260b088cdf79cb5f857a48c428714bfce78)

html:
Colon

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the colon (:) serves the following purposes,

  • : represents a lizard:
    • : newt
    • : gecko
    • : iguana
    • : baby crocodile
    • : lizard
    • : chameleon
    • : crocodile
    • : salamander
  • Press : to use the near look command, which looks at the square you currently are on. In menus, pressing : activates menu search, which helps you select specific items in a menu containing a long list of items.

    • 1.2 UnNetHack
    • 1.3 xNetHack

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces new monsters that use the : glyph:

  • : gila monster
  • : rhaumbusun
  • : basilisk
  • : komodo dragon

UnNetHack

UnNetHack introduces one new monster that uses the : glyph:

  • : giant turtle

xNetHack

In xNetHack, version 3.0 changed the glyph for the lizard monster class to l (lowercase L) to avoid using punctuation glyphs, and moved leprechauns into the ​i imp or minor demon class. This was reverted in version 6.0.[1]

EvilHack

EvilHack introduces two new monsters that use the : glyph:

  • : giant turtle
  • : frost salamander

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the monsters added in SlashTHEM and adds new monsters that use the : glyph:

  • : deminewt
  • : master newt
  • : giant turtle

References

  1. ↑ xNetHack commit 6f0e026: "Move lizards back to : and leprechauns back to l"
